trans-unit.source: Establishes the common events and also the event-related properties and methods for basic input processing by Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) elements.
Although this interface is public, it is not intended to be implemented in application or framework-building scenarios.

This interface is public because of the inheritance requirements for connecting the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] core to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] framework.

You can also use this interface as a casting mechanism to enforce that the input events and properties will come from either a <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement> or <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement>, which can be handled in the same input model.
For more information, see [WPF Architecture](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/wpf-architecture.md) and also see [Base Elements Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/base-elements-overview.md).
Adds a routed event handler for a specific routed event to an element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
The identifier for the routed event that is being handled.
A reference to the handler implementation.
Attempts to force capture of the mouse to this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
`true` if the mouse is successfully captured; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to force capture of the stylus to this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
`true` if the stylus is successfully captured; otherwise, `false`.
Attempts to focus the keyboard on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
`true` if keyboard focus is moved to this element or already was on this element; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether focus can be set to this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.Focusable%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the element can have focus set to it; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the element captures the mouse.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the mouse, that element receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its bounds.
The mouse is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.
Occurs when the element captures the stylus.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the stylus, that element receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its bounds.
The stylus is typically captured in this manner only during drag-and-drop operations, and retains capture until the drop action of the drag-and-drop operation occurs.
Gets a value that indicates whether this element is enabled in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_ui](~/includes/tlasharptla-ui-md.md)].
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsEnabled%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsEnabled%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) make this property read/write and establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the element is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this element has keyboard focus.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocused%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocused%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if this element has keyboard focus; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether keyboard focus is anywhere inside the element bounds, including if keyboard focus is inside the bounds of any visual child elements.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsKeyboardFocusWithin%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if keyboard focus is on the element or its child elements; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse is captured to this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the element has mouse capture; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the mouse pointer is over this element; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the mouse pointer is located over this element (including visual children elements that are inside its bounds).
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsMouseOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsMouseOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the mouse pointer is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is captured to this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusCaptured%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the element has stylus capture; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is over this element in the strictest hit testing sense.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusDirectlyOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the stylus is over the element; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether the stylus is located over this element (or over visual child elements that are inside its bounds).
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Some core classes that implement <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement>, such as <xref:System.Windows.UIElement>, also implement an event that tracks changes to this property.
However, this interface does not include such an event as part of its contract.

Existing implementations in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] core (see <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement.IsStylusOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.IsStylusOver%2A?displayProperty=fullName>) establish this property as a dependency property.
`true` if the stylus cursor is over the element or its child elements; otherwise, `false`.
Occurs when a key is pressed while the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when a key is released while the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the keyboard is no longer focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when this element loses mouse capture.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the mouse, it receives mouse input even if the cursor is outside its borders.
The mouse is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.
Occurs when this element loses stylus capture.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
When an element captures the stylus, it receives stylus input even if the cursor is outside its borders.
The stylus is typically captured only during drag-and-drop operations.
Occurs when the mouse pointer enters the bounds of this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the mouse pointer leaves the bounds of this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the mouse wheel moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when a key is pressed while the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when a key is released while the keyboard is focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the keyboard is no longer focused on this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the mouse pointer moves while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the right mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the right mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the mouse wheel moves while the mouse pointer is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus button is pressed down while the stylus is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus button is released while the stylus is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus touches the digitizer while over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus moves over an element, but without touching the digitizer.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is close enough to the digitizer to be detected.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus moves while the stylus is over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is too far from the digitizer to be detected.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when one of several stylus gestures are detected, for example, <xref href="System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture.Tap"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture.Drag"></xref>.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is raised off the digitizer while over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Raises the routed event that is specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs.RoutedEvent"></xref> property within the provided <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs"></xref>.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs"></xref> class that contains the identifier for the event to raise.
Releases the mouse capture, if this element holds the capture.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Releases the stylus capture, if this element holds the capture.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Removes all instances of the specified routed event handler from this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Identifier of the routed event for which the handler is attached.
The specific handler implementation to remove from this element's event handler collection.
Occurs when the stylus button is pressed while the stylus is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus button is released while the stylus is over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus touches the digitizer while over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus cursor enters the bounds of the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus moves over an element, but without touching the digitizer.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is close enough to the digitizer to be detected.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus cursor leaves the bounds of the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus cursor moves over the element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is too far from the digitizer to be detected.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when one of several stylus gestures are detected, for example, <xref href="System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture.Tap"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture.Drag"></xref>.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when the stylus is raised off the digitizer while over this element.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
Occurs when this element gets text in a device-independent manner.
This interface is not intended for public implementation.
For more information, see remarks for the <xref:System.Windows.IInputElement> interface.
